availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of John H. Perkins and Mariah R. Perkins. Married to Lavinia J. Smith in Madison, Indiana on February 26, 1864. Father of Anna F. Perkins. Resident of Covington, Kentucky in 1850. Resident of Covington, Kentucky in 1860. Admitted to the Kentucky bar in 1863, worked as an attorney in Kenton County, Kentucky.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton, Covington Ward 3, p. 255B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton, Covington Ward 3, p. 639.
Geneaology of the Hannum Family, ed. Curtis H. Hannum (West Chester, PA: Horace F. Temple, 1911), 83.
The Encyclopedia of Northern Kentucky, Paul A. Tenkotte and James C. Claypool, eds. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2009), 710-711.
